newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech crown holds at cen bank fix, market sluggish.
newsitem.headline: Czech crown holds at cen bank fix, market sluggish.

text.p: The Czech crown held steady in dull afternoon trading on Wednesday, hovering at the central bank fixing rate with market sentiment appearing bearish for the week, dealers said.

"The market is quite stabilised within the crown range of 3.0-3.1 percent above basket parity, though I see it on a slight weakening trend, to perhaps the 2.8 percent level through Friday," said Karel Jelinek, a dealer at ING Bank.
At 1445 GMT, the crown was trading at 26.998 against the dollar and 17.675 against the mark, implying a deviation of +3.06 against the basket mid-point.
